title: PGConf US comes to Columbus
excerpt: The Sept meeting will not be held this month. Instead, we’ve worked with PGConf US and Ohio Linux Fest to bring the first ever PostgreSQL conference to Ohio!

title: We now have an Instagram
excerpt: I know you were all eagerly awaiting it.. so I’ve set up an Instagram account for the group. You can follow us at https://www.instagram.com/pgcmh. Right now, we’ve got our very first photos up of @PhilVacca delivering his presentation at the June meeting.

title: Feb meeting announcement
excerpt: The Feb meeting for pgCMH will be held on Tues, Feb 28. Once again, we’ll be holding the meeting at 18:00 EST in the 11th floor community space at CoverMyMeds.

title: Join the conversation on Slack
excerpt: As a user group, one of the goals of pgCMH is helping users interact with the larger community. Whether it be for technical assistance, socializing, advocacy, or other, keeping the conversation going is a large goal for us. Which is why we’re pleased to announce the #pgcmh channel on Slack!

title: January meeting recap
excerpt: pgCMH held its first ever meeting last nite at CoverMyMeds in downtown Columbus. We had an attendance of 10 members (out of 16 that had RSVP’d) and the meeting lasted slightly longer than the hour that was planned. Everyone present had a chance to introduce themselves to the group, explain their PostgreSQL “comfort level”, and provide feedback into what they hoped to gain from the group. In all, it was a very productive meeting!

title: Inaugural pgCMH mtg scheduled
excerpt: As announced on our Twitter, we’ve scheduled our inaugural meeting for Jan 24, 2017 at 1800 hrs. The folks at CoverMyMeds will graciously provide the meeting space (and parking garage) while OpenSCG is buying the pizza!

title: Announcing pgCMH
excerpt: I’ve been kicking around the idea of founding a Columbus-based PostgreSQL User Group for a while now. I even went so far as to float the idea to people at OLF in ‘14. After much hemming and hawing (and no one else stepping up in the interim), I’ve finally gone and done it.

title: Theme Setup
excerpt: Instructions on how to install and customize the Jekyll theme So Simple.

title: About pgCMH
excerpt: pgCMH is the Columbus, OH based PostgreSQL User Group.
